intro: Palicourea bolivarensis, commonly known as the Bolivian palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Bolivia and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have five petals. Palicourea bolivarensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
